none:
Originally ripped by Terminal Escape, posted on June 11, 2020 Description from Terminal Escape:
Over The Flame was a really nice listen this morning. I realize that I don't use the word "nice" too often in these pages, but it was....nice. Philadelphia's John Markow takes a meandering course through primitive Kraut drenched Neue Deutsche Welle, early Windham Hill, and Sir Richard Bishop, with a little touch of Ed fROMOHIO popping into some of the guitars and hints of Alan Vega peeking through the vocals. It's quiet, contemplative, it's shadows of the sounds I referenced above...it's just nice.Â  OVER THE FLAME
https://johnmarkow.bandcamp.com/

seo.title: John Markow - Over The Flame - Terminal Escape
